title: Card Sorting
description: Using JavaScript, creates a program that models a deck of cards and outputs first the unsorted deck and then sorts the deck and outputs the result

title: A Card Game
description: A simple interactive card game using open source code libraries provided via GitHub

title: Quizz App
description: Question-and-answer experience – a browser-based quiz – for this assignment, using the jQuery library

title: Enhanced Quizz
description: Draggable and droppable interactions added to the Quiz developed last week, also widgets from the jQuery UI library

title: jQuery Plugin Promotional Site
description: HTML-based experience that is enhanced by the addition of the Rich Text  and  Lightbox Fading Show plugins

title: A Class Map
description: A map app developed using Google Maps API. It displays several markers and there is a different action associated with cliking each one of them.

title: Map-Based Mobile App
description: This app dislpays two maps, one showing the browser geolocation and another showing markers of several tea gardens in India and Nepal. A click on those markers displays information about the gardes. All based on the Google Maps API.

title: Basic Data Visualizaton
description: Data visualization that incorporates a HTML5 canvas element and geometric shapes. Thsi one draws a pie chart with data read from an external JSON file

title: Advanced Visualization
description: A Bubble Chart using the 3D library, that supports hover and click interations

title: Basic Game
description: Phaser 3 tutorial game with customized sprite and changed scoring system

title: My Game
description: Further customization of last week's assignment, adding sound effects and totally revamped graphical elements and scoring system

title: Draft Mobile App
description: A single web-page that displays all my class assignments for CS50C during Fall 2019, using Vue.js
